page.title: 03EDUCATION IN WESTON
page.content: There are two{schools}in Weston Village,a Voluntary{Independant {Nursery}and a Junior Mixed Infants Voluntary Controlled County School.The {J.M.I. School}is for 4\ to 11 year olds and has four classes arranged in academic year groups. There are five main teachers and a Headmaster. The present school building dates back to {1854.}The main school to which children transfer is{Knights Templar Comprehensive School,Baldock.This is the only school to which transport is provided by{Herts County Council. Sometimes children transfer to schools in nearby Hitchin, Letchworth and Stevenage. The Nursery school was built in{1975 and classes are held every morning and four afternoons. Because it is independent all costs have to be met by funds raised at different events.
